verses.verse: If there is a controversy <S%H7379><s%> between men, <S%H582><s%> and they come <S%H5066><s%> to judgment, <S%H4941><s%> and the judges judge <S%H8199><s%> them; <S%H6663><s%> then they shall justify the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> and condemn <S%H7561><s%> the wicked; <S%H7563><s%>

and it shall be, <S%H7563><s%> if the wicked man be worthy <S%H1121><s%> to be beaten, <S%H5221><s%> that the judge <S%H8199><s%> shall cause him to lie down, <S%H5307><s%> and to be beaten <S%H5221><s%> before his face, <S%H6440><s%> according <S%H1767><s%> to his wickedness, <S%H7564><s%> by number. <S%H4557><s%>

Forty <S%H705><s%> stripes <S%H5221><s%> he may give him, <S%H3254><s%> he shall not exceed; lest, <S%H3254><s%> if he should exceed, and beat <S%H5221><s%> him above these with many <S%H7227><s%> stripes, <S%H4347><s%> then your brother <S%H251><s%> should seem vile to you. <S%H7034><s%>
You shall not muzzle <S%H2629><s%> the ox <S%H7794><s%> when he treads out the grain. <S%H1778><s%>

If brothers <S%H251><s%> dwell <S%H3427><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> and one <S%H259><s%> of them die, <S%H4191><s%> and have no son, <S%H1121><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of the dead <S%H4191><s%> shall not be married outside <S%H2351><s%> to a stranger: <S%H376><s%> her husband <S%H2993><s%>'s brother shall go in <S%H935><s%> to her, <S%H3947><s%> and take her to him as wife, <S%H802><s%> and perform the duty of a husband <S%H2992><s%>'s brother to her.

It shall be, <S%H1060><s%> that the firstborn whom she bears shall succeed <S%H6965><s%> in the name <S%H8034><s%> of his brother <S%H251><s%> who is dead, <S%H4191><s%> that his name <S%H8034><s%> not be blotted out <S%H4229><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

If the man <S%H376><s%> doesn't <S%H2654><s%> want to take <S%H3947><s%> his brother <S%H2994><s%>'s wife, then his brother <S%H2994><s%>'s wife shall go up <S%H5927><s%> to the gate <S%H8179><s%> to the elders, <S%H2205><s%> and say, <S%H559><s%> "My husband <S%H2993><s%>'s brother refuses <S%H3985><s%> to raise up <S%H6965><s%> to his brother <S%H2993><s%> a name <S%H8034><s%> in Israel; <S%H3478><s%> he will <S%H14><s%> not perform the duty of a husband <S%H2992><s%>'s brother to me."

Then the elders <S%H2205><s%> of his city <S%H5892><s%> shall call <S%H7121><s%> him, <S%H1696><s%> and speak to him: <S%H5975><s%> and if he stand, and say, <S%H559><s%> "I don't <S%H2654><s%> want to take her; <S%H3947><s%>"

then his brother <S%H2994><s%>'s wife shall come <S%H5066><s%> to him in the presence <S%H5869><s%> of the elders, <S%H2205><s%> and loose <S%H2502><s%> his shoe <S%H5275><s%> from off his foot, <S%H7272><s%> and spit <S%H3417><s%> in his face; <S%H6440><s%> and she shall answer <S%H6030><s%> and say, <S%H559><s%> "So shall it be done <S%H6213><s%> to the man <S%H376><s%> who does not build up <S%H1129><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%>"
His name <S%H8034><s%> shall be called <S%H7121><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> The house <S%H1004><s%> of him who has his shoe <S%H5275><s%> untied. <S%H2502><s%>

When men <S%H582><s%> strive <S%H5327><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> one with another, <S%H251><s%> and the wife <S%H802><s%> of the one <S%H259><s%> draws near <S%H7126><s%> to deliver <S%H5337><s%> her husband <S%H376><s%> out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of him who strikes <S%H5221><s%> him, <S%H7971><s%> and puts forth her hand, <S%H3027><s%> and takes <S%H2388><s%> him by the secrets; <S%H4016><s%>
then you shall cut off <S%H7112><s%> her hand, <S%H3709><s%> your eye <S%H5869><s%> shall have no pity. <S%H2347><s%>
You shall not have in your bag <S%H3599><s%> diverse weights, <S%H68><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> and a small. <S%H6996><s%>
You shall not have in your house <S%H1004><s%> diverse measures, <S%H374><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> and a small. <S%H6996><s%>

You shall have a perfect <S%H8003><s%> and just <S%H6664><s%> weight. <S%H68><s%> You shall have a perfect <S%H8003><s%> and just <S%H6664><s%> measure, <S%H374><s%> that your days <S%H3117><s%> may be long <S%H748><s%> in the land <S%H127><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> gives you. <S%H5414><s%>
For all who do <S%H6213><s%> such things, <S%H428><s%> all who do <S%H6213><s%> unrighteously, <S%H5766><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>
Remember <S%H2142><s%> what Amalek <S%H6002><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to you by the way <S%H1870><s%> as you came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%>

how he met <S%H7136><s%> you by the way, <S%H1870><s%> and struck the hindmost <S%H2179><s%> of you, <S%H2826><s%> all who were feeble behind <S%H310><s%> you, <S%H5889><s%> when you were faint and weary; <S%H3023><s%> and he didn't <S%H3373><s%> fear God. <S%H430><s%>

Therefore it shall be, <S%H3068><s%> when Yahweh your God <S%H430><s%> has given you rest <S%H5117><s%> from all your enemies <S%H341><s%> all around, <S%H5439><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> which Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> you for an inheritance <S%H5159><s%> to possess <S%H3423><s%> it, <S%H4229><s%> that you shall blot out the memory <S%H2143><s%> of Amalek <S%H6002><s%> from under the sky; <S%H8064><s%> you shall not forget. <S%H7911><s%>
